subject: Running non-standard test suites in Ant

messageBody:
In order to run a test that runs repeatedly, with each run being configured
differently, I have a class
FunctionalTest extends TestCase

The constructor takes the usual test-name and also a config key; the
config is loaded for each instance of my FunctionalTest.

public FunctionalTest(String name, String configKey){
super(name);
loadConfig(configKey);//defined elsewhere
}

I have only one test method (which runs based on the config information),
but when I build a test suite in my static method suite(), I add a number
of new instances of FunctionalTest , each one configured slightly differently.

But I have a problem. When I run this with Ant, the Ant task receives the
class name FunctionalTest, and then builds a suite the standard way on the
basis of the Class object, by finding methods beginning with "test". But I
don't want that. I want Ant to use my non-standard suite that I build in
suite() as described above.

Any suggestions?

Thanks,

Joshua Fox
